text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Israeli newspapers on Tuesday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
JERUSALEM POST
- Egypt said to hold missing Israeli Azam Azam for spying.
- Hebron deal possible in days, says Defence Minister Yitzhak Mordechai.
- Mordechai: Army considers missing soldier Sharon Edri as being held hostage.
- Cairo economic parley opens today.
- Trade deficit breaks $9 billion barrier in first 10 months.
- Africa-Israel's new owner Lev Leviev sees active role at company.
- Teva Pharmaceutical Industries profits up 21.5 percent in third quarter.
- Rafael workers angry at decision to make it a state company.
- Knesset approves 9.7 percent water price hike for farmers.
- Bezeq launches universal Internet access.
- Insurers appoint complaints officers.
GLOBES
- Treasury Director-General David Brodett says he hopes that by the year 2000 the banking establishment in Israel will be privately owned.
- Yuli Ofer in negotiations to participate in establishing power stations in India with investment of billions of dollars.
- Vote on raising the minimum wage won't be brought to a vote in the Knesset during the next two weeks.
- In letter to IMF, industrialists head Dan Propper attacks report on Israel.
HAARETZ

- Economic conference opens today in Cairo; Egypt will focus on cooperation among Arabs. Americans hope to clinch agreement on Hebron redeployment before Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu leaves for U.S. on Wednesday night.
- Lebanese newspaper claims: missing Israeli airman will be freed soon in return for Moslem clergymen Dirani and Obeid held by Israel.

- "Israel 2000" programme of the prime minister's office will be presented to local council heads; director-general Avigdor Lieberman initiates transfer of two million dunams of land from regional councils to development towns.
- Ultra-Orthodox neighbourhood in Bet Shemesh heights to be built on dozens of burial caves which were destroyed.
MAARIV
- Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak: Complete the Hebron agreement immediately. Israeli intention to renew talks at a high level -- and reach an agreement quickly.
- Major-General Oren Shahor to be released soon from army duty.
- Cairo: The Israeli who was arrested "a Mossad agent".
- Proposal being discussed: Giving the "Little Triangle" to the Palestinians -- for settlements.
- Yehoshua Matza to be appointed health minister and Tsachi Hanegbi to be made justice minister.
- New Tel Aviv municipality sticker: Here we don't speak on cell phones.
YEDIOTH AHRONOTH
- Egypt: We arrested "a spy for the Mossad". Israel: A libel.
- Netanyahu ready to promise Palestinian President Yasser Arafat in writing a continuation of Oslo agreement.
- Commentator Nahum Barnea writes that in five months Netanyahu has accomplished almost nothing. Instead of making the tough decisions, he travels to the United States.
